page.title: 03Guisborough Forest
page.content: The woodland belt surrounding the town to the S.is administered by the NYM Forest District,HQ at Pickering.The plantations were estab.in the '50s on moorland.They have mostly Japanese Larch & Scots Pine.2,500 trees were planted per hectare;after a few years it was thinned to allow growth.The larch is used locally for fencing;Nor- way Spruce & Scots Pine are sold in bulk to merchants & to the public loc- ally for Xmas trees.Guisb.woods'main use is for recreation:walking,horse riding & shooting.The Forestry Comm.has no plans for expansion in the area.In the NYM District as a whole the For.Comm.employs 91 including 10 rangers responsible for conservation & wildlife control.The woods have roe- deer,but little bird life (wood pig- eons,bluetits,goldcrests)& few small mammals owing to the lack of light.
